definition.name: set-shell-env
definition.description: Exports as workflow variables a subset of the shell environment variables, accessible in any step using 'env.VAR-NAME'
definition.author: Luca Cappa https://github.com/lukka

inputs.name: shell
inputs.description: < The command to execute to start the shell.

inputs.name: args
inputs.description: < Arguments to be provided to the shell to list the environment variables in form "name=value", as the 'env' Un*x command does.

inputs.name: filter
inputs.description: < A regular expression that selects which environment variables (defined in the specified shell) to be set in the workflow.

evidence.reasoning: This action is primarily focused on managing environment variables, which can be considered a part of dependency management in workflows. It also provides documentation through its description and input parameters.
